name: UGC-NET (National Eligibility Test)
description: A national-level examination to determine the eligibility for the post of 'Assistant Professor' and for 'Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) and Assistant Professor' in Indian universities and colleges.
conductingBody: National Testing Agency (NTA) on behalf of the University Grants Commission (UGC)

eligibility.ageLimit:
For JRF: Not more than 30 years as on the first day of the month in which the examination is concluded. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories. 
For Assistant Professor: There is no upper age limit.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Candidates who have secured at least 55% marks (without rounding off) in a Masterâ€™s Degree or equivalent examination from universities/institutions recognized by UGC. A relaxation of 5% is available for OBC-NCL/SC/ST/PwD/Third gender candidates. Candidates appearing for their final year examination are also eligible.

timeline.examDate: The exam was conducted on June 18, 2024, but was subsequently cancelled by the Ministry of Education. New dates are yet to be announced. The exam is held twice a year, typically in June and December.
timeline.resultDate: To be announced after the re-examination.

examPattern.mode: Offline (Pen & Paper based, OMR). (Note: This was changed from Online CBT for the June 2024 cycle).

stages.name: Combined Examination (Paper I & Paper II)
stages.description: A single examination session of 3 hours without any break, consisting of two papers. Paper I is common for all candidates, and Paper II is based on the subject selected by the candidate.

examPattern.markingScheme: Both papers consist of objective type, multiple-choice questions. Paper I has 50 questions for 100 marks. Paper II has 100 questions for 200 marks. Each question carries 2 marks. There is no negative marking for incorrect answers.

syllabus.name: Paper-I: General Paper on Teaching and Research Aptitude
topics: Higher Education System: Governance, Polity and Administration

syllabus.name: Paper-II: Subject Specific
topics: This paper is based on the subject selected by the candidate from a list of 83 subjects. The syllabus is based on the postgraduate curriculum for that subject and can be downloaded from the official UGC-NET website.
